description: Origin unknown. First known use as a verb is 1905, as a noun 1948. Perhaps compare regional slang term wang, whang (“to whack or beat”).

nouns.description: wank (countable and uncountable, plural wanks) (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand)

entries.meaning: (countable, slang, vulgar) An act of masturbation.
examples: Synonyms: jerk off, toss, tug, fingering; see also Thesaurus:masturbation

entries.meaning: (countable, slang, vulgar, derogatory) An undesirable person.
examples: You utter wank! How could you behave like that?
Did you see that thing on Channel 4? Yeah, it was a wank.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, chiefly vulgar, fandom slang and Internet slang) Ridiculous, circular or inappropriately elaborate argument about something, especially if obnoxious, pretentious or unsubstantial.
(countable, uncountable, fandom slang) Drama, turmoil, or disagreement within a fannish space.
examples: Sometimes those involved in the wank will attempt to steer discussion by disguising themselves with a different user name and posting their own support.

verbs.description: wank (third-person singular simple present wanks, present participle wanking, simple past and past participle wanked) (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand)

examples: I was so embarrassed when my mother caught me wanking.

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang, vulgar) To masturbate; to give a hand job to.
examples: She wanked me in the morning.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, vulgar, chiefly fandom slang and Internet slang) To argue in an inappropriate manner or about pretentious or insubstantial matters; to engage in wank.
